text:
Raskolnikov walked from the bridge, his footsteps heavy. 

"Strength, strength is what one wants," he muttered. 

Pride swelled within him. He felt alive again. 

"Could I really live?" he wondered, surprised. 

He laughed at the thought of his prayers. 

“Thy servant Rodion,” he recalled, feeling lighthearted. 

Soon, he reached Razumihin's place. 

The door stood wide open. Laughter and chatter spilled out. 

He paused, listening to the lively gathering inside. 

Servants bustled nearby, preparing food and drinks. 

Raskolnikov took a deep breath and stepped in.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov feels a surge of pride and self-confidence as he contemplates his life and the possibility of change.
